intro: Lirianthe nana, commonly known as the dwarf lirianthe, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many plants with showy spadices and berries. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 30 centimeters, featuring broad, heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a bright red, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Lirianthe nana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and wetlands.
